Frederick.Monocacy River bridge and viaduct: The Monocacy river bridge and viaduct is a 326-foot (99 m) open deck steel girder bridge with two main spans crossing the river and 2 viaduct sections crossing the floodplain, south of Walkersville, Maryland. Originally constructed by the Frederick and Pennsylvania Line Railroad Company (F&PL). Construction began in late 1871, and continued until July 1872 when the railroad opened that year.
